clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Butorphanol for Preoperative Anxiety Patients on Intraoperative Sedation and Postoperative Sleep Quality
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Butorphanol for Preoperative Anxiety Patients on Intraoperative Sedation and Postoperative Sleep Quality

brief_summary.textblock: Lower extremities surgery in orthopedics mostly adopt spinal anesthesia, it is characterized by fewer complications in central nervous system, good analgesic effect, less drug use and the exact effect of anesthesia. And it is especially suitable for the elder patients with complicated preoperative complications, poor tolerance to narcotic drugs, and narrow range of tolerating circulation fluctuations. But because the patients are awake during the operation, the surgical stimulation and psychological stress can aggravate the fear and anxiety of the preoperative anxiety patients which would make patients suffer from postoperative sleep disorder and a variety of complications. The purpose of this paper is to observe after using butorphanol for sedation in the operation, the correlation between the degree of preoperative anxiety and the time of achieving satisfactory sedation during the operation and meanwhile observe the correlation between the degree of preoperative anxiety and postoperative sleep quality of patients

detailed_description.textblock: 60 cases of patients undergoing spinal anesthesia during lower extremities surgery in orthopedics American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status Ⅰ-Ⅱ, male or female, age between 18 and 80 years old. The Amsterdam preoperative anxiety and information scale (APAIS) and The Athens Insomnia Scale(AIS) are used evaluate the preoperative anxiety and sleep quality of the patients. After the completion of spinal anesthesia puncture operation, an load dose infusion butorphanol 15μg/kg was infused and 7.5μg/kg/h to maintain, the time when Ramsay sedation score reach 4 ,total dose of butorphanol , sedative effects and intraoperative adverse reactions were recorded. And reassess postoperative sleep quality of patients 24 hours after the operation.

primary_outcome.measure: preoperative anxiety assessed by the Amsterdam preoperative anxiety and information scale (APAIS)".
primary_outcome.description: tested the degree of preoperative anxiety one day before the surgery
record the time when the patient fall asleep

primary_outcome.measure: preoperative sleep quality assessed by the Athens Insomnia Scale(AIS)
primary_outcome.description: tested the sleep quality one night before the surgery

primary_outcome.measure: postoperative sleep quality assessed by the Athens Insomnia Scale(AIS)
primary_outcome.description: tested the sleep quality 24h after the surgery

arm_group.description: all the patients received an load dose infusion butorphanol 15μg/kg was infused and 7.5 μg/kg/h to maintain.

intervention.description: After the completion of spinal anesthesia puncture operation, and 5 min before the operation an load dose infusion butorphanol 15μg/kg was infused and 7.5 μg/kg/h to maintain.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA Ⅰ-Ⅱ
- age 18-80 years
- surgical operation of lower extremities in orthopedics
- no contraindication of epidural anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- with central system disease
- with cardiovascular disease
- with autonomic nervous system disease
- long term use of analgesic drugs ,sedative drugs,and anti-anxiety drugs
- language barrier
- unwilling to cooperate with the experimenter
